column2: Ratings are designed to give the challenger a general idea of what to expect, and won't always coincide with personal experience: sometimes it will feel harder and sometimes it will feel easier.

column4: Star Diagram and Explanation
column5: Square-Enix Equivalent

column4: ★☆☆☆☆ - Designed to be as easy as they come, with pure Skill focus and light application of other Sub-types; mostly everyone can clear
column5: Cliffhanger GATEs; Fall of Belah'dia & Falling City of Nym GATEs

column4: ★★☆☆☆ - Offers a solid challenge to most players, possibly simple for veteran jumpers; more complex mechanics and jumps present
column5: Kugane Tower; Sylphstep GATE

column4: ★★★☆☆ - "Party Finder Bounty" difficulty, extremely tough for most players with full range of mechanics possible; still a challenge for vets
column5: Second half of Moonfire Tower (Only available during event)

column4: ★★★★☆ - An extremely broad difficulty that encompasses the most difficult courses; veterans will find a vast range of difficulties here
column5: Very top of Moonfire Tower ("toothpick" section) is borderline 4★ (without using bomb platforms near the top)

column4: ★★★★★ - Reserved for the hardest of the hard; designed to obliterate challengers
column5: Square-Enix isn't sadistic enough to make these

column4: ☆☆☆☆☆ - A puzzle meant to instruct or introduce certain techniques, or provide a space to practice these techniques
☆☆☆☆☆ - A puzzle built specifically for an event, usually only open a few days at a time
☆☆☆☆☆ - A puzzle that is temporary or only open for a limited time; may close permanently or be replaced with another build eventually
☆☆☆☆☆ - A puzzle that undergoes considerable, gradual change rather than remaining static like most puzzles

column2: Sub-type Keys: Know What Skillset to Bring

Sub-types can seem overwhelming at first, but they can provide information about what skillset you'll need to bring for success. Please note that higher difficulty puzzles may not always reveal needed techniques!

column4: Means the puzzle:
column5: More Info

column4: has hard-to-find or maze-like paths, furniture combinations with hard-to-solve interactions; tricky, misleading, or deceptive elements
column5: M+ can signify Mystery complex enough to greatly affect the difficulty rating

column4: has points where /sit or /doze interactions with furnishings are required to cross gaps or walls; these points can be hidden
column5: E+ indicates that emotes will trigger furniture movement ("slides"), potentially locking you out and forcing a re-entry to reset

column4: makes you wait on Sprint cooldown due to early or multiple long jumps, only applies when jumps are near/beyond max Peloton range
column5: Combat this by bringing extra speed buffs such as Expedient (Scholar) or Moon Flute (Blue Mage)

column4: uses furnishings you need to run straight into until they let you pass through them; Phasing is often banned so check puzzle rules!
column5: P+ requires Jump Phasing ("Forbidden Tech") to prevent phasing through what you're standing on

column4: has vertical gaps that can only be crossed using a void jump and are required to complete the puzzle
column5: A void jump is performed by running straight over the void for a second before jumping underneath your desired landing

column4: has gaps that can only be crossed using specific job abilities, i.e. En Avant, Elusive Jump, Aetherial Manipulation, Hell's Ingress/Egress, etc
column5: J+ requires a specific job such as Blue Mage for Co-op puzzles, or when only certain job abilities will navigate gaps

column4: has furnishings that disappear and reset in a predetermined order
column5: G+ has multiple stages of Ghost that will disappear and reset in predetermined orders

column4: employs the above mechanics in unconventional ways that redefine what a jump puzzle truly is; can be viewed as a modifier for the other tags
column5: L+ requires deep understanding of techniques that may be used together to create significant obstacles to solve

column4: is subject to a no streaming/recording request from the builder for any number of reasons
column5: Some builders prefer to keep a low profile or keep their puzzles mysterious, please respect their wishes!

column2: Some terms may sound familiar to community veterans, but can often be unknown or misunderstood by newcomers.

column4: Explanation
column5: More Info

column4: Some builders prefer to not have their puzzles streamed or have videos posted
column5: Notated by a red X on addresses, ask for more info available in our Discord

column4: In main menu: Social > Housing > Return to Front Door/Chamber Door
column5: Useful for when you get stuck or lost

column4: Some puzzles have conditions or rules to provide the builder's intended experience
column5: Check the room greeting or the puzzle directory listing

column4: Some puzzles have extra conditions to alter the primary experience or add difficulty
column5: Check the message book, room greeting, or puzzle directory listing

column4: Adding a builder or FC member to your friend list to use Estate Teleportation command when right-clicking that player's name
column5: Useful for gaining access to Shirogane/Empyreum, bypasses MSQ requirements; restricted to ward you teleported to

column4: What a house or room looks like from outside once you break through the walls or ceiling
The black space outside of the housing cube
When there are no surfaces (furnishing or housing cube) below you or the furnishing you're standing on
column5: You must be over the void to perform a void jump

column4: Client-side furnishing movement caused by /sit and /doze, as well as returning to chamber door and being raised
column5: Can also be triggered by builders upon exiting the furnishing placement menu

column4: Client-side furnishing disappearance, LOD setting must be off to cause this to function properly (console works by default)
column5: System Config > Graphics Settings > General > un-check "use low-detail models on distant objects" (off by default on PS4/PS5)

column2: Having a huge list of addresses is no good without if you don't know how to find them!

column4: Main City Aethernet Access Conditions
column5: More Info

column4: "Where the Heart Is (The Goblet)" found in Western Thanalan (Lv 5), Accessible on foot from level 2
column5: Exit Ul'dah Steps of Nald via Gate of the Sultana (Western Thanalan), Head south from Scorpion Crossing

column4: "Where the Heart Is (The Lavender Beds)" found in Central Shroud (Lv 5), Accessible on foot from level 2
column5: Exit New Gridania via Blue Badger Gate (Central Shroud), Head south from Bentbranch Meadows to the ferry

column4: "Where the Heart Is (Mist)" found in Lower La Noscea (Lv 5), Accessible on foot from level 2
column5: Exit Limsa Upper Decks via Tempest Gate (Lower La Noscea), Head northeast towards Red Rooster Stead

column4: "I Dream of Shirogane" found in Kugane (Lv 61)
column5: Requires completion of "By the Grace of Lord Lolorito" (Patch 4.0) or friend teleport

column4: "Ascending to Empyreum" found in Ishgard (Lv 60)
column5: Requires completion of "Litany of Peace" (Patch 3.3) or friend teleport

column4: Wing 1: apartments in same instance as plots 1-30; Wing 2: apartments in same instance as plots 31-60 (subdivision)
column5: Example: Take aetheryte to Topmast for wing 1, to Topmast Subdivision for wing 2
